description: Nothing will harm him from Allah.
zekr: In the name of Allah with whose name nothing is harmed on earth nor in the heavens and He is The All-Seeing, The All-Knowing.
O Allah, by your leave we have reached the morning and by Your leave we have reached the evening, by Your leave we live and die and unto You is our resurrection.

We have reached the morning upon the natural faith of Islam, and upon the word of pure faith, and upon the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), and the faith of our forefather Ibraheem, who was a Muslim and of true faith and was not of those who associate others with Allah.
How perfect Allah is and I praise Him by the number of His creation and His pleasure, and by the weight of His throne, and the ink of His words.
O Allah, grant my body health, O Allah, grant my hearing health, O Allah, grant my sight health. None has the right to be worshipped except You.
O Allah, I take refuge with You from disbelief and poverty, and I take refuge with You from the punishment of the grave. None has the right to be worshipped except You.

O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in this life and the next. O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in my religious and worldly affairs, and my family and my wealth. O Allah, veil my weaknesses and set at ease my dismay. O Allah, preserve me from the front and from behind and on my right and on my left and from above, and I take refuge with You lest I be swallowed up by the earth.
O Ever Living, O Self-Subsisting and Supporter of all, by Your mercy I seek assistance, rectify for me all of my affairs and do not leave me to myself, even for the blink of an eye.

We have reached the morning and at this very time all sovereignty belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the seen, Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things, I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil, and from committing wrong against my soul or bringing such upon another Muslim.
I take refuge in Allah's perfect words from the evil He has created.

I seek forgiveness from Allah the Almighty, whom there is none worthy of worship except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence, and I repent to Him.
O Lord, praise is for You as befits the majesty of Your Face and the greatness of Your authority.
O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, good provision, and acceptable deeds.

description: A good remembrance.

O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil of every creature whose forelock You hold. Indeed, my Lord is on a straight path.

description: His sins will be erased even if they were like the foam of the sea.
zekr: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him.
The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever says: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him one hundred times in a day, his sins will be erased even if they were like the foam of the sea.'

And he (peace be upon him) said: 'Whoever says: There is no god but Allah alone, no partner for Him, to Him belongs sovereignty, and to Him belongs praise, and He is over all things competent, ten times, it is as if he freed four souls from the descendants of Ishmael.'
And he (peace be upon him) said: 'Two words that are light on the tongue, heavy on the scale, beloved to the Most Merciful: Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him, Glory be to Allah the Great.'
And he (peace be upon him) said: 'To say: Glory be to Allah, Praise be to Allah, There is no god but Allah, Allah is the Greatest, is more beloved to me than everything the sun rises upon.'

And he (peace be upon him) said: 'Is one of you unable to earn one thousand good deeds every day?' One of his companions asked: 'How can one of us earn one thousand good deeds?' He said: 'Glorify one hundred times, and one thousand good deeds will be written for him or one thousand sins will be erased from him.'
'Whoever says: Glory be to Allah the Great and praise be to Him, a palm tree will be planted for him in Paradise.'

And he (peace be upon him) said: 'O Abdullah bin Qais, shall I not guide you to a treasure from the treasures of Paradise?' I said: 'Yes, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: 'Say: There is no power or strength except with Allah.'

And he (peace be upon him) said: 'The most beloved words to Allah are four: Glory be to Allah, Praise be to Allah, There is no god but Allah, Allah is the Greatest. It does not harm you which one you start with.'

A Bedouin came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and said: 'Teach me words to say.' He said: 'Say: There is no god but Allah alone, no partner for Him, Allah is the Greatest, much praise be to Allah, Glory be to Allah Lord of the worlds, There is no power or strength except with Allah the Almighty the Wise.' He said: 'These are for my Lord, what about for me?' He said: 'Say: O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, provide for me.'

When a man embraced Islam, the Prophet (peace be upon him) taught him prayer, then ordered him to supplicate with these words: 'O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, grant me health, and provide for me.'
'Indeed, the best supplication is praise to Allah, and the best remembrance is There is no god but Allah.'
The enduring good deeds: Glory be to Allah, Praise be to Allah, There is no god but Allah, Allah is the Greatest, There is no power or strength except with Allah.

zekr: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'When it is the darkness of night - or when you reach evening - restrain your children, for the devils spread out at that time. When an hour of the night passes, release them. Close the doors and mention the name of Allah, for Satan does not open a closed door. Tie your water skins and mention the name of Allah. Cover your vessels and mention the name of Allah, even if you place something across it, and extinguish your lamps.'

category: Legitimate Ruqyah from the Prophetic Sunnah
search: Legitimate Ruqyah from the Prophetic Sunnah
zekr: O Allah, send blessings upon Muhammad and upon the family of Muhammad as You sent blessings upon Ibrahim and upon the family of Ibrahim, indeed You are Praiseworthy, Glorious. O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim in the worlds, indeed You are Praiseworthy, Glorious.

category: Legitimate Ruqyah from the Prophetic Sunnah
search: Legitimate Ruqyah from the Prophetic Sunnah
zekr: In the name of Allah, I perform Ruqyah for you, from everything that harms you, and from the evil of every soul or envious eye, Allah heals you, in the name of Allah I perform Ruqyah for you.

category: For the one who wakes up at night
search: For the one who wakes up at night
zekr: Whoever wakes up at night and says: There is no god but Allah alone, no partner for Him, to Him belongs sovereignty and to Him belongs praise, and He is over all things competent. Praise be to Allah, Glory be to Allah, There is no god but Allah, Allah is the Greatest, There is no power or strength except with Allah. Then says: O Allah, forgive me, or supplicates; it will be answered for him. If he performs ablution and prays, his prayer will be accepted.
